com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags
Class DefineSound

java.lang.Object
  com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags.Tag
      com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags.DefinitionTag
          com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags.DefineSound
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class DefineSound
extends DefinitionTag

This tag defines an event sound.

Warning: you are responsible for obtaining technology licenses needed for encoding and decoding sound data (see e.g. mp3licensing.com for details on mp3 licensing).

Since:
SWF 1
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Summary

          ADPCM compressed sound format (simple compression algorithm without licensing issues).

          mp3 compressed sound format (for high-quality sound encoding) (since SWF 4).

FORMAT_UNCOMPRESSED

public static final byte FORMAT_UNCOMPRESSED
Uncompressed sound format. For 16-bit samples, native byte ordering (little-endian or big-endian) is used. Warning: this introduces platform dependency!

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FORMAT_UNCOMPRESSED_LITTLE_ENDIAN

public static final byte FORMAT_UNCOMPRESSED_LITTLE_ENDIAN
Uncompressed little-endian sound format, i.e. 16-bit samples are decoded using little-endian byte ordering (platform-independent format) (since SWF 4).

See Also:

Constructor Detail

DefineSound

public DefineSound(int characterId,
                   byte format,
                   byte rate,
                   boolean is16BitSample,
                   boolean isStereo,
                   long sampleCount,
                   byte[] soundData)
Creates a new DefineSound instance. Supply the character ID of the sound, the encoding format (one of the provided FORMAT_... constants), the sampling rate (use RATE_... constants), specify whether 8-bit or 16-bit samples are used (8-bit samples are allowed only for uncompressed formats) and whether the sound is mono or stereo (Nellymoser merely supports mono). Provide the number of samples (for stereo sound: sample pairs) and, finally, the actual sound data as raw data.

Parameters:
characterId - character ID of sound
format - encoding format (use provided constants)
rate - sampling rate (use provided constants)
is16BitSample - if true, 16-bit samples are used (otherwise 8-bit, for uncompressed formats only)
isStereo - if true, sound is stereo, otherwise mono
sampleCount - number of samples (stereo: sample pairs)
soundData - raw sound data

Checks whether the sample size is 16 bit or 8 bit.

Returns:
true if 16-bit sample size, false if 8-bit

Returns:
